question: [File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Prune race condition] Can concurrent pruning operations on overlapping version ranges cause some EventByVersionSchema entries to be deleted multiple times or skipped? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Prune boundary error] When pruning from start to end version, can off-by-one errors cause events at boundary versions to be incorrectly deleted or retained? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Concurrent write conflict] Can multiple threads writing to EventByVersionSchema for the same event key at different versions cause RocksDB write conflicts or lost updates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Read-write race] Can a reader using get_latest_sequence_number observe a partially written batch where some events at a version are indexed but others aren't? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Iterator invalidation] If events are deleted from EventByVersionSchema while an iterator is active, can this cause the iterator to skip entries or return corrupted data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Stack overflow] If EventKey contains deeply nested or recursive structures, can to_bytes() cause stack overflow during BCS serialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Memory leak] Does decode_key properly clean up allocated memory for EventKey deserialization on error paths, or can repeated failures leak memory? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Index explosion] Can an attacker create millions of events in a single transaction, causing EventByVersionSchema to grow unbounded and exhaust storage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Size calculation error] Does size_of::<Self>() correctly compute the size of (EventKey, Version, SeqNum) tuple accounting for padding, or can mismatches cause ensure_slice_len_eq to accept invalid data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Non-canonical encoding] Can two different serialization paths produce different byte representations for the same (EventKey, Version, SeqNum), causing duplicate entries in the index? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Index bounds validation] Is there validation that stored Index values are within the event count for the transaction, preventing out-of-bounds array access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [BCS version skew] Can EventKey structures serialized with different BCS versions fail to deserialize correctly, causing index corruption during upgrades? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [BCS length prefix attack] Does EventKey.to_bytes() include length prefixes that could be manipulated to cause buffer overflow during concatenation with version/seq_num? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [BCS trailing bytes] If EventKey deserialization from data[..EVENT_KEY_LEN] succeeds but leaves trailing bytes, can this indicate truncated or corrupted data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Write failure handling] If write_u64::<BigEndian> for version succeeds but seq_num write fails, is the partially encoded buffer discarded or can it corrupt the database? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Graceful degradation] When decode_key encounters corrupted data, does it return a clear error or can it cause cascading failures across the storage layer? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Recovery from corruption] If EventByVersionSchema becomes corrupted, is there a mechanism to rebuild indices from EventSchema, or is data permanently lost? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Non-deterministic encoding] Can EventKey.to_bytes() produce different output on different validator nodes due to platform-specific BCS behavior, causing consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Floating point issues] If EventKey or related structures contain floating point values, can their serialization be non-deterministic across platforms? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Index ordering divergence] Can different RocksDB configurations on validator nodes cause EventByVersionSchema iterators to return events in different orders? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [V2 translation sequence conflict] When V2 events are translated to V1 and indexed, can sequence number generation collide with existing V1 events, overwriting indices? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Translation cache poisoning] Can malicious V2 events exploit the translation cache to inject incorrect sequence numbers into EventByVersionSchema indices? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [V1/V2 mixing] When both V1 and translated V2 events are indexed for the same event key, can this create ambiguous or conflicting entries in EventByVersionSchema? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Historical query manipulation] Can an attacker craft queries with specific ledger_version values to retrieve events that should be hidden or access pruned data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Iterator position exploit] In lookup_event_before_or_at_version using seek_for_prev, can carefully crafted event patterns cause the iterator to return events from wrong event streams? (High)
